data.title: Tracey Grammer, Camp Sunrise
data.meta_description: Make Promises Happen - A Camp for Conquerors of Brain Injury.
data.text:
The April 9, 2019 meeting was called to order by Pres. John Gorton. The prayer was provided by Rot. Ron Sanders and the pledge by Rot. Tim Elliott. Our talented music leader, Rot. Mitch Williams, lead the group in the Pink Floyd song âComfortably Numbâ. The Rotarian of the Day was Mary Kate Henson who introduced Tracey Grammer, founder/director of Camp Sunrise. Catering was provided by Interurban Grill.

Pres. Gorton giving the Fun Facts for the day:

National Barbershop Quartet Day!

1945 â âCitationâ was born (winner of the 1948 Triple Crown, first to win $1,000,000)

1970 â Apollo 13 launched and the famous phrase, âHouston, we have a problemâ was stated.

Local History â instead of a Barbershop Quartet, a âquartet of barber shopsâ from Chickashaâs history!

GUESTS:

Rot. Gerron Smith with his employee, Katrina Marchbanks.

Shevon Blair with Rot. Charlie Burruss

Rot. Ron Sanders with his son/employee, Daniel Sanders and guest Heather Roehrick.

Rot. Smith providing the Sunshine report.

Sgt. of Arms Brad Duvall asking about the news story and announcing itâs Rot. Steve LaForgeâs birthday. Happy Birthday!

President Gorton reading where a Rotarian made a newsworthy event (LaForge and Bogle).

FINES:

Rot. Gerron Smith â your guest works where?

Rot. Mitch Williams â time to pay up!

Rot. Ron Sanders â where does your son work?

Rot. Ronnie Bogle â great news story!

ROTARIAN OF THE DAY:

ROTD Mary Kate Henson

Tracey Grammer, a very talented lady talking about Camp Sunrise for people that have had severe head traumas. What an inspiration!

Catering was provided by Rock Island Grill, Chickasha.

Pictured is Rot. Bob Hays and Bill McVey.
